div.div: the action or process of adding something to something else.
Instructions for using the addition function on the JPS Calculator app.

the process or skill of taking one number or amount
away from another.
Instructions for using the subtract function on the JPS Calculator app.

obtain from (a number) another that contains the
first number a
specified number of times.
Instructions for using the multiply function on the JPS Calculator app.
The method for dividing large numbers into smaller groups or parts.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: the action or process of adding something to something else.
Addition is adding number(s) or value(s) to another number or value.
If we begin with the number [8] and add [5] to it, we are left with [13].
In the JPS Calculator App the addition fucntion is represented by the [+] key.
Instructions for using the addition function on the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To succesfully add numbers, you must understand the definition of addition.

li.span: Enter the first number by pressing it.
Enter the second number by pressing it.

div.section: The sum of the equation is displayed on the screen.

The first number [8] plus [+] the second number [5] equals [=] 13.
8 + 5 = 13

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: the process or skill of taking one number or amount away from another.
Subtraction is removing one number or value from another.
If we begin with the number [8] and remove (subtract) [5], we are left with [3].
In the JPS Calculator App the subtracting fucntion is represented by the [-] key.
Instructions for using the subtract function on the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To succesfully subtract numbers, you must understand the definition of subtraction.

li.span: Enter the first number by pressing it.
Enter the second number by pressing it.

div.section: The sum of the equation is displayed on the screen.

The first number [8] minus [-] the second number [5] equals [=] 3.
8 - 5 = 3

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: obtain from (a number) another that contains the first number a specified number of times.
To multiply a number we take an established number and repeat it as many times as determined by the second number.
If we begin with the number [8] and repeat it (multiply) [5] times (8+8+8+8+8), we are left with [40].
In the JPS Calculator App the multiply fucntion is represented by the [x] key.
Instructions for using the multiply function on the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To succesfully multiply numbers, you must understand the definition of addition.

li.span: Enter the first number by pressing it.
Enter the second number by pressing it.

div.section: The sum of the equation is displayed on the screen.

The first number [8] plus [+] the second number [5] equals [=] 13.
8 + 5 = 13

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: The method for dividing large numbers into smaller groups or parts.
To divide a number we take an established number and seperate it as many times as determined by the second number.
If we begin with the number [40] and separate it (divide) into [5] equal parts, we are left with [8] parts.
In the JPS Calculator App the divide fucntion is represented by the [/] key.
